website_summaries.verdict: Excellent performing HDD that's perfect for NAS systems and is available in capacity sizes up to 12 TB.
pros: HDD that's optimized to work with always-on NAS systems, so it can handle a huge workload over time
Will work in NAS systems up to 8 bays or in individual computer setups
Ships in storage capacities between 1 TB and 12 TB
Will give you a pretty good price per TB of storage
cons: Occasional build quality issues right out of the box

customer_reviews.title: I have 8 of theses running 2 raid 5's and they have done great. I am using them in a NAS
customer_reviews.text: No errors to speak of yet. I have 8 of theses running 2 raid 5's and they have done great. I am using them in a NAS. They are a little slow but I do not need them to be fast since they are being used for a NAS. I have had no real read/write errors and they have been running non-stop for over 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Slow Drive
customer_reviews.text: Using bench32 large file size with an esata buss, Thermaltake bay I only got 113 MB/s writing and 130 MB/s reading. That is not very good at all. I purchased a HGST 1 TB laptop hard drive at the same time and got 145 MB/s writing and 148 MB/s reading. If you care about speed this is not the drive your looking for!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Seagate Storage Drives Reliably Protect Your Data
customer_reviews.text: Seagate makes great hard drives at affordable prices. They also provide free, user-friendly partitioning software from their website.
customer_reviews.author: DonJ

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace some WD Reds I had installed in my NAS. The Reds kept having disk errors and finally one quit. So I decided to buy 4 of these and have not had one issue with the drives. These will be my first choice if I ever need to up my storage. Plus they were slightly cheaper then the WD Reds.
customer_reviews.author: Steve D.

customer_reviews.title: looking for new drives for my NAS.. these came highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Have been using these a year now. Absolutely love them. quiet, great performance, and have been perfect with still 0 bad sectors on either drive (mirrored) some 18 months later.
customer_reviews.author: Pop ina Bottle

customer_reviews.title: 6 months on a small home server with no issues thus far.
customer_reviews.text: Running this on an Odroid HC2 with Open Media Vault on my home network. No issues after six months. Hopefully being a mighty Iron Wolf that will continue.
customer_reviews.author: A fellow named Bob

customer_reviews.title: it's quiet and cool. works great
customer_reviews.text: replaced a dying TiVo premeire XL drive. I used MFStools v3.2 and done! it's quiet and cool. works great.
customer_reviews.author: Your Average American Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Works great in RAID on server
customer_reviews.text: I use these in a simple R5 8 drive array on a small business server. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: No Public Name

customer_reviews.title: Great NAS drives
customer_reviews.text: So far they are the quietest drives, I have ever had. They are in My QNAP NAS drive, and are running at all times, quiet, quick and after a few months very reliable.
customer_reviews.author: S. Di Matteo

customer_reviews.title: It so easy to install and it work out of the box
customer_reviews.text: It so easy to install and it work out of the box
customer_reviews.author: David Le

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: Sold a drive that does not work. I put it into three different enclosures and no go. Waste of time. It was half the price of the other used drives and now I understand why. The part I don't understand is why it was sold as working.
customer_reviews.author: Ray D.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality hard drives. They are easy to install in a NAS and they are durable. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Goicochea

customer_reviews.title: Working Well
customer_reviews.text: Using a couple of these in a file server to create a large raid. The storage size is very nice, and performance has been quick.
customer_reviews.author: R.L.

customer_reviews.title: Works great and great price!
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Very fast and easy install for my internet server. Recommended by me for AVSIM.com.
customer_reviews.author: Landru

customer_reviews.title: Product as described
customer_reviews.text: It's really hard to go wrong with drives like these. They're intended for server setups. Are you setting up a server situation (RAID, NAS, SAN)? Use something like these.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product at a great price - I buy these ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product at a great price - I buy these for all of my clients that want a NAS storage device - I use them with the Synology NAS.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Received 5900RPM drives, not 7200RPM as advertised
customer_reviews.text: As the title says, received drives that were not to spec of the listing. 5900RPM not 7200RPM as advertised. Very annoyed.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Wave

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Had these for about a year now in my NAS and havent seen any problems
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Be support in the industry!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Saved my butt and Seagate's support was AWESOME... it's the only drive I will buy.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: NAS Drive
customer_reviews.text: It does the job. My satisfaction will be tested over time.
customer_reviews.author: LAB

customer_reviews.title: Great drive
customer_reviews.text: Completely satisfied with this hard drive. Extremely quiet and very fast access time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Noisy drive
customer_reviews.text: I just received my drive and after formatting it I installed it into my server pool and the drive is extremely noisy and sound like a fish tank pump which is what I believe someone described it as. My guess is the reason these are selling cheap is because they are cheap or they are being sold as defects. Sucks when you can't trust what you buy these days.
customer_reviews.author: M. Howell

customer_reviews.title: Quality Drive
customer_reviews.text: I did not expect to purchase drives but after some research, I decided to purchase these drives for my NAS. They have been installed for about a month and I am very happy with the performance. Delivery was quick and packaging was exceptional. I would recommend to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D Marion

customer_reviews.title: Great response time re
customer_reviews.text: Great response time re: order. Have NOT installed/tried units at this point, as my NAS errors have "died down". But I suspect that my original HHD's will be generating errors in the near future and will install new devices at that time. Every review I have read has been positive of the Seagate Ironwolf drives.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You can't write a review if only in use for 30 days
customer_reviews.text: How in the HELL can you review a drive that has only been in service for less than 30 days come back and ask this in 3 to 4 years!!! The reason to spend the extra money on these drives is for expected life span ask on a review after 5 years to see if they ares still humming!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Roger A.

customer_reviews.title: Few months, no issues
customer_reviews.text: After a few months in a high usage NAS, no issues. If I can say the same thing in a few years, then I'll re-order.
customer_reviews.author: DHO

product_meta.title: Seagate IronWolf 2TB NAS Internal Hard Drive HDD – 3.5 Inch SATA 6Gb/s 5900 RPM 64MB Cache for RAID Network Attached Storage (ST2000VN004)
product_meta.description: Purpose built for multi-user NAS environments, IronWolf is perfect for teams needing to store more and work faster. Designed for up to 8 bays and featuring 2TB and speeds of up to 180MB/s, these internal hard drives are specifically built for less wear and tear, little to no noise/vibration, no lags or down time, increased file-sharing performance, and lower power consumption. Easily monitor the health of hard drives using the integrated IronWolf Health Management system and Enjoy long-term reliability with 1M hours MTBF and the included three-year limited warranty protection plan.
feature_bullets: IronWolf internal hard drives are the ideal solution for up to 8-bay, multi-user NAS environments craving powerhouse performance
Store more and work faster with a NAS-optimized hard drive providing 2TB and cache of up to 64MB
Purpose built for NAS enclosures, IronWolf delivers less wear and tear, little to no noise/vibration, no lags or down time, increased file-sharing performance, and much more
Enjoy long-term reliability with 1M hours MTBF
Three-year limited warranty protection plan included

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars148 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
